meanings.sent1: She always makes sure to presignalling her intentions before making a move.
meanings.sent2: The train conductor began presignalling the upcoming stop to the passengers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel presignalled its friends about the approaching human with a series of chirps.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds presignalled an incoming storm, warning everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: By presignalling his actions, he avoided any misunderstandings or confusion.

meanings.definition: The act of signaling before something happens
meanings.sent1: The presignalling of the alarm system alerted the security guards to the possible break-in.
meanings.sent2: Presignalling is crucial in ensuring a smooth flow of traffic during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The presignalling of the surprise party almost gave away the secret to the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: The presignalling of the birds flying south indicated the change of seasons.
meanings.sent5: The presignalling of the fireworks display excited the crowd gathered in the park.
